title: Keyboard stops working all together suddenly
body: I need help. My computer is a Lenovo Ideapad Y700. Sometimes when I'm playing, my keyboard stops functioning all together. I can't alt-tab, type,  nothing. This is really frustrating because the only thing I can do is power off my computer to get the keyboard working again. But then it'll happen again later in the game or the games afterwards. Does anyone know how I can fix this issue? That would be great!

replies.body: No fix on this yet? I'm having the same issue.

I'm having the same problem, same laptop. This **ONLY** happens with League, none of my other games. I've tried Riots troubleshooting for the problem to no avail. I've re-installed the game, and still the problem persists. I've checked via Lenovo that all my software was up-to-date. I'm grasping for anything at this point, I can't do anything about it except hard-restart my laptop, which temporarily fixes the problem. I'd love to play this game, but whatever this is, is causing me to not play.

Interesting that this specifically happens on the Lenovo Y700. A lof of the time when weird things like this happen, it's usually caused by one of the many pieces of software that ship with the laptop. I recommend [performing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) of Windows to eliminate any potential problematic background apps. I also recommend [hopping into your windows power settings](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq6) and ensuring you've selected *High Performance* mode.

Let me know if this helped.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=PaEHWqJc,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-10-19T02:20:15.462+0000)
>
> Interesting that this specifically happens on the Lenovo Y700. A lof of the time when weird things like this happen, it's usually caused by one of the many pieces of software that ship with the laptop. I recommend [performing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq3) of Windows to eliminate any potential problematic background apps. I also recommend [hopping into your windows power settings](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq6) and ensuring you've selected *High Performance* mode.
> 
> Let me know if this helped.

I did both of these and it worked for one game then right when the second game started the keyboard stopped working. This has made ranked unplayable for me.
Can you please revisit this issue.
Can someone explain why nobody has responded to the riot member in the thread in a year lol
Same problem, same computer. Guess we have to post this in the Lenovo forum for an answer?

I am having the same problem as all of you. My lenovo ideapad Y700.
Has anyone fixed this?

Also, things I tried that did not work:
1. un-installing lenovo bloatware
2. performing a clean boot
3. re-installing the game
4. deleting the config file and letting the game replace it
5. deleting persistedsettings.json file and letting the game replace it
6. doing a system-update on the lenovo support website
7. updating keyboard drivers

I too have the same problem but it didn't start for me until after the new league client was released. I received some help on here but the fix was only temporary as I found out last night. It has led to many annoying leaver buster penalties. Not sure if any of you found solutions yet but as I was browsing forums I came across this...https://forums.lenovo.com/t5/Gaming-Laptops/ideapad-y700-windows-10-keyboard-stops-working/td-p/3464406 

I haven't had a chance to update it yet so I'm not sure if it works. I plan on trying when I get home from work today. If anyone else has done this did it fix the problem? If you haven't done it, and you try it let the rest of us on here know if it works.
still no fix on this yet? guess ill leave lol again until there is

This problem is still happening. I reinstalled league and reinstalled drivers. When I manually shutdown via power button I hear a pop. Please, please Riot. I can not play the game this way. Happens almost every game.
I have same laptop y700 and obviously the same issue. If anybody knows how to resolve it please post an answer! It is really frustrating.

This is really frustrating because the only thing I can do is power off my computer to get the keyboard working again. But then it&#039;ll happen again later in the game or the games afterwards. i had he same problems this whole week, something about LOL and how the program i think, i am checking into how it integrates, stay tuned.
Experiencing the same problem. When I use an external keyboard attached via usb, no problem. When I travel and use the Y700 keyboard, problem comes up.
im having this issue i have found i can alt escape out. but this is really frusterating when it happens multiple times in a single game
Same laptop (Ideapad Y700), same problem. Guys, I feel like I've literally tried everything in the book. I don't know what to do. If someone finds a solution, please share.

I am having the same problem, it happens when I play league of legends, I am using a Lenovo Y700 and every now and then while playing the game, the keyboard becomes unresponsive. has anyone found any solutions for this yet?
Did you ever figure out how to fix it, I have the same computer and same issue as you.
Im guessing that every player with lenovo ideapad y700 has the same problem. Sadly,im also one of them.

I'm having the same problem here on my y700. I'm playing LoL and suddenly my keyboard becomes unresponsive. I've played out a game once in this condition and my keyboard remains unresponsive afterwards. At first I thought it was a corrupt file so I repaired, and when that didn't work, I reinstalled. However, it still occurs. I don't believe it is a hardware problem though because like op, I don't have this problem with any other games which require keyboard. If anyone has a solution, it would be much appreciated!
Sounds more like an issue with your computer, not the game.
Really? It hasn't happened to me while I'm playing other games. That's why I thought it was an issue with League.
Oh, hmm, that is odd. Besides trying a reinstall, I have no solution
